page.title: 11Wild life in Willenhall
page.content: On St Giles church there is a kestrel nest and there are swifts and house sparrows nesting in the tower.Some of the nests are wrecked because they are built in the bells.At my old school we built a bird table and made a study of the birds which came.There were robins blackbirds,starlings and various sorts of tits attracted by the hanging nuts which we put out.We even saw some white doves on the school roof.In my house there are some sparrows nesting in the attic and during July 4 chicks have fallen out and have died. Although Willenhall is an industrial area there is still plenty of wildlife to see.At Noose Lane there used to be a pond which has been turned into a nature area.It is common to see hedgehogs in the streets at night and even foxes can be seen scavenging in the dustbins.
